latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: By Mr. DANNY K. DAVIS of Illinois:H.R. 5787.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, which states ``The Congress shallhave Power To lay and collect Taxes. . .,'' and Article I,Section 7, which states ``All Bills for raising Revenue shalloriginate in the House of Representatives.''[Page H8365]

item.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from gross income payments received by a student under a comprehensive work-learning-service program operated by a work college.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude payments received under the Work Colleges Program from gross income, including payments made from institutional funds.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude payments received under the Work Colleges Program from gross income, including payments made from institutional funds.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude payments received under the Work Colleges Program from gross income, including payments made from institutional funds.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.latestTitle: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude payments received under the Work Colleges Program from gross income, including payments made from institutional funds.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
